text: <@U8THBCFC4> Can I get in on that blog beta too?
Sure thing <@UDHT6N5SM>! Can you DM me your portal ID?

It would be great if we could see the # of sections in a DND area and have it available.

USE CASE: I've got styles that are set for nth child of the internal elements in the DND area, but I'd like to set the options for css classes for the immediately above or below items of the DND area based on whether something is even or odd for instance.
“Sections” are really just those top level rows, the length of that rows array should === number of sections
Is this the rows by default? or is it  the actual information in the dnd_area in this example
